title: Florida shatters U.S. record for largest single-day increase in coronavirus cases
Sunday Scrum: WE Charity controversy widens
description: CBC News Network's Sunday Scrum panel is your destination for frank discussion and analysis of the week's big political stories. This week: Our panellists discuss the Conservative Party's continuing efforts to investigate Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his ties to WE Charity.

title: Strapped for cash? How to uncover unclaimed money that may belong to you
description: Cash-strapped during the COVID-19 pandemic due to the economic slowdown? To find out if you have any unclaimed funds from your past, here are some free, simple ways to launch a search.

title: Why Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest could turn up the heat on Prince Andrew
description: When British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire on charges related to the investigation into convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, it cast renewed attention on a royal friend to them both: Prince Andrew.

title: Conservatives call on Trudeau to appear before committee studying WE controversy
description: Opposition Conservatives are demanding that Prime Minister Justin Trudeau testify before the House of Commons finance committee as it prepares to study how much the government spent in awarding a now-cancelled contract to WE Charity.

title: Quebec police seek to narrow search for man whose daughters turned up dead after crash
description: Quebec provincial police have set up a perimeter around a wooded area in Saint-Agapit—Saint-Apollinaire and are asking people to call 911 if they have any information in the deaths of two sisters whose disappearance triggered an Amber Alert.

title: Officials investigating after 'rare' collision between ships in Ontario's Welland Canal
description: Officials are investigating how two cargo vessels came to collide in Ontario's Welland Canal on Saturday during what should have been a routine manoeuvre.

title: Mobster Pat Musitano has been shot and killed. What happens now?
description: Pasquale (Pat) Musitano was killed on Friday in Burlington, Ont. Mafia experts say the notorious Hamilton mobster was living on borrowed time long before the fatal shot was fired.

title: Trudeau's past ethics transgressions hurt the Liberals. Will it happen again?
description: Twice before, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has been found to be in violation of government ethics rules. If the WE Charity contract controversy has the same impact, the Liberals could find their hold on their minority government in danger.

title: Iran blames missile strike that downed Ukrainian airliner on bad communication, poor alignment
description: Iranian investigators are blaming a misaligned missile battery and miscommunication between soldiers and their commanders for the Revolutionary Guard shooting down a Ukrainian jetliner in January, killing 176 people, including 55 Canadians.

title: Canada halts Ukraine puppy imports; New rules against vaping ads: CBC's Marketplace Cheat Sheet
description: CBC's Marketplace rounds up the consumer and health news you need from the week.

title: Bollywood's Bachchan family hit by coronavirus
description: Three generations of Bollywood's Bachchan family were hit by the coronavirus as former Miss World Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and her daughter on Sunday joined her father-in-law Amitabh and husband Abhishek in testing positive for the virus that causes COVID-19.

title: WE Charity lays off contract workers who would have administered student service grant
description: WE Charity laid off hundreds of contract workers who were brought in to administer the federal government's Canada Student Service Grant, according to a statement from the charity on Saturday.

title: Bill before Commons could be tweaked to improve RCMP oversight, says Goodale
description: Former public safety minister Ralph Goodale says a bill now stalled in the House of Commons could be augmented to improve RCMP oversight — a suggestion that comes as calls to reform the national police force increase.

title: As permafrost thaws under intense heat, Russia's Siberia burns — again
description: It's hotter than ever in northern Russia and the implications for the earth's climate are significant. Currently, 1.77 million hectares of land are burning with expectations that the total fire area could eventually surpass the 17 million hectares that burned in 2019.

title: Ubisoft Canada CEO resigns amid harassment claims made against several employees
description: Yannis Mallat, the president of Ubisoft Canada, resigned Saturday evening with immediate effect, according to a statement from the company. The announcement comes in the wake of a series of allegations, made throughout the company, of sexist behaviour, abuse of power and harassment.

title: Trump wears face mask in public for 1st time during military hospital visit
description: U.S. President Donald Trump wore a mask during a visit to a military hospital on Saturday, the first time the president has been seen in public with the type of facial covering recommended by health officials as a precaution against spreading or becoming infected by the novel coronavirus.

title: Justin Trudeau drops into another pitfall of his own making
description: For whatever reason, the prime minister and his office seem to have a recurring problem of failing to check themselves. As a result, they have now repeatedly wrecked themselves.

title: Robert Mueller defends Russia probe, says Roger Stone 'remains a convicted felon' in op-ed
description: An op-ed in The Washington Post marked Robert Mueller's first public statement on his investigation since his congressional appearance last July.

title: Mother charged after stabbing sent 2 children to hospital
description: A 36-year-old mother is being charged with multiple counts of attempted murder, aggravated assault and assault after a stabbing sent her two children to the hospital in North York on Saturday morning, Toronto police say.
